c26173fb-4b7b-4537-b430-ffa57143cec9.description: The course objective is to provide students with the entry-level knowledge and skills necessary to safely participate in scuba dives to a depth of 60 feet/18 meters, or shallower.
c26173fb-4b7b-4537-b430-ffa57143cec9.name: Open Water Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the open water diver final exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during 5 confined water training dives and 4 open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

bdcb7184-5266-4259-9a9c-80cced3c022e.description: Provide advanced training that expands the student's diving knowledge and skills beyond that learned during an entry-level course. The course also provides divers with a structured means to explore areas of special diving interests and gain dive experience. The course sets the foundation for additional training, not only for PADI Specialties, but also for meeting other PADI course prerequisites that build on skills divers acquire during the training dives.
bdcb7184-5266-4259-9a9c-80cced3c022e.name: Advanced Open Water Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery during five open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 100%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

6ee9a0e5-9d73-4fef-80b0-9e3b3fd85a75.description: The course objective is to develop the knowledge and skills necessary to effectively perform diver assists and rescues, manage diving accident situations and render first aid. Rescue Diver training expands the basic problem prevention and accident management skills divers learn beginning with the PADI Open Water Diver course. At the Rescue Diver level, divers are ready to learn to manage more complex dive emergencies and to apply direct intervention techniques to assist others in an emergency.
6ee9a0e5-9d73-4fef-80b0-9e3b3fd85a75.name: Rescue Diver (v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, completion of the rescue diver final exam, evaluation of performance mastery during 10 confined/open water training exercises and 2 open water rescue scenarios, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

abcddbf0-261f-4525-9f66-8030a81a6b59.description: The course objective is to familiarize divers with the knowledge, skills, techniques and procedures necessary to safely plan, organize and participate in deep dives between the depths of 60 feet/18 meters to 130 feet/40 meters
abcddbf0-261f-4525-9f66-8030a81a6b59.name: Deep Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery during four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 100%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

a244bf40-82f5-4ee4-a877-2adb8b15d66f.description: The course is designed to bring a diver's knowledge and skills to the professional level. PADI Divemaster training develops leadership abilities, qualifying candidates to supervise dive activities and assist instructors with student divers. PADI Divemaster is the prerequisite certification for both the PADI Assistant Instructor and PADI Open Water Scuba Instructor certifications.
a244bf40-82f5-4ee4-a877-2adb8b15d66f.name: Divemaster (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery during confined and open water training sessions, exercises, and workshops and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.

Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, case studies, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercise, work-based learning.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 3 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

513bfcde-c30e-4964-9305-363c355ad015.description: The course objective is to develop the student diver's practical knowledge of underwater navigation, and to enable the diver to plan, organize, and execute dives using natural and compass navigation.
513bfcde-c30e-4964-9305-363c355ad015.name: Underwater Navigator (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery skills during three open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 100%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

745de83a-e79e-40b7-a39f-52bb813dc792.description: The course objective is to familiarize divers with the knowledge, skills, techniques and procedures necessary to safely plan, organize, and participate in night dives.
745de83a-e79e-40b7-a39f-52bb813dc792.name: Night Diver (v.6)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of skills during three open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

593f6165-563c-4c95-8b7e-4d1e06b2fea0.description: The course objective is to familiarize divers with the knowledge, skills, techniques and procedures necessary to safely plan, organize, and participate in wreck dives.
593f6165-563c-4c95-8b7e-4d1e06b2fea0.name: Wreck Diver (v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery skills during four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

5f398642-1341-41b8-95a7-8f99e23c503b.description: The course objective is to familiarize divers with the knowledge, skills, techniques and procedures necessary to safely plan, organize and execute search and recovery dives.
5f398642-1341-41b8-95a7-8f99e23c503b.name: Search and Recovery Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery skills during four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d65a0068-0306-4da8-bbdb-c789caab2bda.description: The course objective is to familiarize divers with the knowledge, skills, techniques and procedures necessary to safely plan, organize, and conduct dry suit dives.
d65a0068-0306-4da8-bbdb-c789caab2bda.name: Dry Suit Diver (v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water training dive and two open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

18d10dc6-e5a5-46e4-8dd4-2444ea61eca5.description: The course objective is to prepare the instructor candidate to function as a PADI Open Water Scuba Instructor. The program further develops leadership and teaching abilities to the instructor level and prepares candidates to teach PADI courses. PADI Open Water Scuba Instructors are qualified to conduct the entire range of PADI experience programs and PADI courses from Open Water Diver through Divemaster.
18d10dc6-e5a5-46e4-8dd4-2444ea61eca5.name: Instructor Development Course (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the Dive Theory and Systems, Standards and Procedures Exams, evaluation of 3 knowledge development teaching presentations, 4 confined water teaching presentations, and 2 integrated open water teaching presentations, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.

Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 6 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

5a57d79e-bea9-45da-b099-138019eb135a.description: The course objective is to provide qualified individuals with the additional training necessary to teach the Emergency First Response Primary Care CPR (Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation), Secondary Care (First Aid), CPR & AED (Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation and Automated External Defibrillator), and Care for Children courses.
5a57d79e-bea9-45da-b099-138019eb135a.name: Emergency First Response Instructor Training Course (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion the EFR Instructor Course Final Exam, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, coaching/mentoring, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

73071a5b-db02-4772-a579-0199b3f2e38a.description: The course objective is to introduce and familiarize the student with the use of special procedures, equipment, scene handling, communication procedures, basic public safety diving search and rescue techniques, and documentation requirements.
73071a5b-db02-4772-a579-0199b3f2e38a.name: Public Safety Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, An evaluation of performance mastery skills during four open water training dives and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

8a458603-9376-4d16-abc8-aaf9c80fddea.description: The course objective is to bridge the gap between recreational diving and full technical deep decompression diving. The course prepares divers to make limited decompression dives using equipment that is marginally more extensive than that used in mainstream recreational diving.
8a458603-9376-4d16-abc8-aaf9c80fddea.name: Tec 40 Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Tec 40 Diver Final Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during the three practical assessments and four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

562eacf2-6503-405f-a616-fd44a4293a16.description: The course objective is to train divers to plan and make no stop recreational dives using Sidemount configuration for one or two cylinders. The course covers the basic equipment requirements, setup, dive planning and the skills needed to use Sidemount for recreational diving.
562eacf2-6503-405f-a616-fd44a4293a16.name: Sidemount Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the Sidemount Diver Knowledge Review, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one practical application session, one confined water training dive and three open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d0aa22aa-9e18-4936-8820-37bf56629f83.description: The course objective is to introduce Tec 40 divers to the first stages of full, technical deep decompression diving. Certified Tec 45 divers are qualified to make multistop decompression dives that employ enriched air and oxygen for accelerated decompression. The course not only develops the knowledge and skills to make open circuit technical dives as deep as 45 meters/145 feet, but also begins developing the knowledge and skills the diver will need at the Tec 50 level and beyond.
d0aa22aa-9e18-4936-8820-37bf56629f83.name: Tec 45 Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Tec 45 Diver Final Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during the three practical assessments and four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

db7aa59f-5c7f-4122-af74-9b4e2941949b.description: The course objective is to introduce Tec 45 divers to the first stages of full, technical deep decompression diving. Certified Tec 50 divers are qualified to make multistop decompression dives using air, enriched air and oxygen with up to two gases for accelerated decompression. The Tec 50 expands the knowledge and skill base of the Tec 45 diver with an added emphasis on mission planning and execution.
db7aa59f-5c7f-4122-af74-9b4e2941949b.name: Tec 50 Diver (v.4)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Tec 50 Diver Final Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during the three practical assessments and four open water training dives. and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

087ef806-9c88-4bc2-95dd-8f79d3c31141.description: The course objective is to train divers to plan and make dives with technical Sidemount equipment within their present certification and experience limits. The course develops equipment-related motor skills and underlying knowledge for the use of Sidemount in technical diving. Though the course introduces divers to concepts and procedures used in deep decompression, cave and other forms of decompression diving, it does not qualify them to participate in those activities.
087ef806-9c88-4bc2-95dd-8f79d3c31141.name: Tec Sidemount Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the 2 Tec Sidemount Diver Knowledge Reviews, evaluation of performance mastery skills during three practical application sessions, one confined water training dive and four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: laboratory, discussion, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

08ab8ef6-623e-45bf-9244-87b3e4aaa57b.description: The objective of the course is to expand freediving knowledge and skills, with further development in static apnea, dynamic apnea, free immersion, and constant weight freediving to a maximum of 24 meters/80 feet.
08ab8ef6-623e-45bf-9244-87b3e4aaa57b.name: Advanced Freediver (v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Advanced Freediver Course Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water and two open water training sessions, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

d73fedd3-eae9-45f3-82ef-b28f9ee45e42.description: The course objective to qualify divers to plan and make no-stop dives to the maximum depth of the Type R rebreather unit or gas they are using, or 30 meters/100 feet (40 meters/130 feet if they are also certified as a PADI Deep Diver), whichever is less, in conditions comparable to or better than those in which they are trained and have experience.
d73fedd3-eae9-45f3-82ef-b28f9ee45e42.name: Advanced Rebreather Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, complete the Advanced Rebreather Diver Final Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water training dive and four open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

4f796978-24ca-4594-ae33-a4945c04df59.description: The course objective is to assure candidates understand the PADI freediver program structure, philosophy, requirements and procedures; prepare candidates to teach courses that are low-stress, performance based, safety-oriented and learner-centered; refine candidates' freediving skills to a role-model level; and provide candidates with practical suggestions for organizing and marketing their courses.
4f796978-24ca-4594-ae33-a4945c04df59.name: Freediver Instructor Training Course (v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Freediver Instructor Exam, three evaluated confined water training workshops and three evaluated open water training sessions, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

f64cde88-190e-4c50-9695-4203fa5406ad.description: The course objective is to develop the student's understanding of the underwater world and how it interacts with the body, and how that affects the body when freediving; guide students in choosing appropriate equipment for freediving; and develop the knowledge and skills for basic static apnea, dynamic apnea, free immersion and constant weight freediving to a maximum depth of 16 meters/55 feet.
f64cde88-190e-4c50-9695-4203fa5406ad.name: Freediver (v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Freediver Course Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water and two open water training sessions, with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

8db6b816-b5e0-4e41-b958-5f0a718ced3f.description: The course objective is to expand freediving knowledge and skills, with further development in static apnea, dynamic apnea, free immersion, and constant weight freediving to a maximum of 27 meters/90 feet.
8db6b816-b5e0-4e41-b958-5f0a718ced3f.name: Master Freediver (v.2)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, examinations, presentations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Master Freediver Course Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water and two open water training sessions, and more with a minimum passing score of 75%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, learner presentations, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

8f7027c1-5175-4fef-aa85-6ca8d8938550.description: The course objective is to qualify divers to plan and make no stop dives to a maximum depth of 18 meters/60 feet, and perform post-dive care, with the specific Type R rebreather they train with during the course, in conditions generally comparable to or better than those in which they train.
8f7027c1-5175-4fef-aa85-6ca8d8938550.name: Rebreather Diver (v.3)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include written papers, examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, complete the Rebreather Diver Final Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during one confined water training dive and five open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, practical exercises, lectures.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 2 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.

6710b94e-3046-4e47-931a-0d0405fb74b9.description: The course objective is to extend the depth range available to technical divers trained and qualified to use air, enriched air, and oxygen for technical decompression dives beyond 50 meters/165 feet in open water. The approach is an instructional progression that directly addresses the added hazards, greater demands and challenges present in technical diving, most of which become more pronounced in the depth ranges typically associated with Trimix use.
6710b94e-3046-4e47-931a-0d0405fb74b9.name: Tec Trimix Diver (v.5)

issuer.summary: issued by Professional Association of Diving Instructors (PADI)

badge_template_activities.title: The methods of assessment include examinations, quizzes, performance rubrics/checklists, completion of the PADI Tec Trimix Diver Exam, evaluation of performance mastery skills during the five practical assessments and eight open water training dives, and more with a minimum passing score of 80%.
Instructional strategies include: audio visual materials, laboratory, discussion, computer-based training, practical exercises, lectures, classroom exercise.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 1 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.
